text: Who is the author of the first Epistle of Peter?
verseText: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, To those who are elect exiles of the Dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

text: A major theme in 1 Peter is how believers should respond to what?
verseText: Beloved, do not be surprised at the fiery trial when it comes upon you to test you, as though something strange were happening to you. But rejoice insofar as you share Christ's sufferings, that you may also rejoice and be glad when his glory is revealed. (ESV) [See also 1:6-7, 2:19-21, 3:14]

text: 1 Peter 1 describes the believer's inheritance as what?
options: Imperishable, undefiled, and unfading, kept in heaven
verseText: to an inheritance that is imperishable, undefiled, and unfading, kept in heaven for you,

text: What command does Peter give in 1 Peter 1:15-16, quoting Leviticus?
verseText: but as he who called you is holy, you also be holy in all your conduct, since it is written, “You shall be holy, for I am holy.”

text: In 1 Peter 2, believers are described using what titles?
options: A chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for his own possession
verseText: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for his own possession, that you may proclaim the excellencies of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.

text: How does Peter instruct believers to relate to governing authorities (1 Peter 2)?
options: Be subject for the Lord's sake to every human institution
verseText: Be subject for the Lord's sake to every human institution, whether it be to the emperor as supreme, or to governors as sent by him to punish those who do evil and to praise those who do good.

text: 1 Peter 3 provides instructions for wives and husbands. What example is given for wives regarding submission and conduct?
options: Holy women of the past, like Sarah
verseText: Likewise, wives, be subject to your own husbands... For this is how the holy women who hoped in God used to adorn themselves, by submitting to their own husbands, as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord.

text: What should be the believer's response when asked about the hope that is in them (1 Peter 3)?
options: Always be prepared to make a defense with gentleness and respect
verseText: but in your hearts honor Christ the Lord as holy, always being prepared to make a defense to anyone who asks you for a reason for the hope that is in you; yet do it with gentleness and respect,

text: According to 1 Peter 4, since Christ suffered in the flesh, believers should arm themselves with what same way of thinking?
verseText: Since therefore Christ suffered in the flesh, arm yourselves with the same way of thinking, for whoever has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin,

text: Who does Peter warn believers about in 1 Peter 5, describing him as a 'roaring lion'?
verseText: Be sober-minded; be watchful. Your adversary the devil prowls around like a roaring lion, seeking someone to devour.

text: To whom was 1 Peter originally written?
options: Elect exiles of the Dispersion in various regions of Asia Minor
verseText: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, To those who are elect exiles of the Dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

text: According to 1 Peter 1, believers have been born again to what?
options: A living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ
verseText: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! According to his great mercy, he has caused us to be born again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

text: What is the purpose of trials mentioned in 1 Peter 1?
options: To test the genuineness of faith, proving it more precious than gold
verseText: In this you rejoice, though now for a little while, if necessary, you have been grieved by various trials, so that the tested genuineness of your faith—more precious than gold that perishes though it is tested by fire—may be found to result in praise and glory and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ.

text: Who inquired and searched carefully about the salvation believers now enjoy?
verseText: Concerning this salvation, the prophets who prophesied about the grace that was to be yours searched and inquired carefully, inquiring what person or time the Spirit of Christ in them was indicating when he predicted the sufferings of Christ and the subsequent glories.

text: With what were believers redeemed from their futile ways, according to 1 Peter 1?
verseText: knowing that you were ransomed from the futile ways inherited from your forefathers, not with perishable things such as silver or gold, but with the precious blood of Christ, like that of a lamb without blemish or spot.

text: What are believers urged to put away in 1 Peter 2, before craving spiritual milk?
options: All malice, deceit, hypocrisy, envy, and slander
verseText: So put away all malice and all deceit and hypocrisy and envy and all slander.

text: Like newborn infants, what should believers crave?
verseText: Like newborn infants, long for the pure spiritual milk, that by it you may grow up into salvation—

text: In 1 Peter 2, Jesus is referred to as the living stone, rejected by men but what in God's sight?
verseText: As you come to him, a living stone rejected by men but in the sight of God chosen and precious,

text: What happens to those who reject Christ, the cornerstone, according to 1 Peter 2?
options: They stumble because they disobey the word
verseText: So the honor is for you who believe, but for those who do not believe, “The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone,” and “A stone of stumbling, and a rock of offense.” They stumble because they disobey the word, as they were destined to do.

text: How should believers conduct themselves among the Gentiles (non-believers)?
options: Keep their conduct honorable, so Gentiles may glorify God
verseText: Beloved, I urge you as sojourners and exiles to abstain from the passions of the flesh, which wage war against your soul. Keep your conduct among the Gentiles honorable, so that when they speak against you as evildoers, they may see your good deeds and glorify God on the day of visitation.

text: What specific instruction does Peter give to servants/slaves regarding their masters?
options: Rebel if the master is harsh
Be subject with all respect, not only to the good but also to the unjust
verseText: Servants, be subject to your masters with all respect, not only to the good and gentle but also to the unjust.

text: What example did Christ leave for believers in His suffering?
options: He made threats when He suffered
He entrusted Himself to God who judges justly
verseText: For to this you have been called, because Christ also suffered for you, leaving you an example, so that you might follow in his steps... When he was reviled, he did not revile in return; when he suffered, he did not threaten, but continued entrusting himself to him who judges justly.

text: What should be the imperishable beauty for wives, instead of external adornment?
options: The hidden person of the heart with the gentle and quiet spirit
verseText: Do not let your adorning be external—the braiding of hair and the putting on of gold jewelry, or the clothing you wear— but let your adorning be the hidden person of the heart with the imperishable beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which in God's sight is very precious.

text: How are husbands instructed to live with their wives in 1 Peter 3?
options: In an understanding way, showing honor
verseText: Likewise, husbands, live with your wives in an understanding way, showing honor to the woman as the weaker vessel, since they are heirs with you of the grace of life, so that your prayers may not be hindered.

text: What general instruction does Peter give to all believers regarding their interaction with one another in 1 Peter 3?
options: Have unity of mind, sympathy, brotherly love, a tender heart, and a humble mind
verseText: Finally, all of you, have unity of mind, sympathy, brotherly love, a tender heart, and a humble mind.

text: Instead of repaying evil for evil, what response does Peter call for?
verseText: Do not repay evil for evil or reviling for reviling, but on the contrary, bless, for to this you were called, that you may obtain a blessing.

text: 1 Peter 3 mentions Christ preaching to spirits in prison. This likely refers to His proclamation after what event?
verseText: For Christ also suffered once for sins, the righteous for the unrighteous, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh but made alive in the spirit, in which he went and proclaimed to the spirits in prison, because they formerly did not obey, when God's patience waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was being prepared, in which a few, that is, eight persons, were brought safely through water. (ESV)

text: What does Peter say baptism now saves believers through?
options: The removal of dirt from the body
The resurrection of Jesus Christ, as an appeal to God for a good conscience
verseText: Baptism, which corresponds to this, now saves you, not as a removal of dirt from the body but as an appeal to God for a good conscience, through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,

text: According to 1 Peter 4, how should believers live the rest of their time in the flesh?
verseText: so as to live for the rest of the time in the flesh no longer for human passions but for the will of God.

text: What activity does Peter emphasize as particularly important because 'the end of all things is at hand'?
options: Being self-controlled and sober-minded for prayer
verseText: The end of all things is at hand; therefore be self-controlled and sober-minded for the sake of your prayers.

text: Above all, what quality should believers maintain earnestly among themselves, because it covers a multitude of sins?
verseText: Above all, keep loving one another earnestly, since love covers a multitude of sins.

text: How should believers use the spiritual gifts they have received?
options: To serve one another, as good stewards of God's varied grace
verseText: As each has received a gift, use it to serve one another, as good stewards of God's varied grace:

text: If believers suffer according to God's will, what should they do?
options: Entrust their souls to a faithful Creator while doing good
verseText: Therefore let those who suffer according to God's will entrust their souls to a faithful Creator while doing good.

text: What instructions does Peter give to elders regarding shepherding the flock?
options: Exercise oversight willingly, eagerly, and as examples, not for shameful gain
verseText: shepherd the flock of God that is among you, exercising oversight, not under compulsion, but willingly, as God would have you; not for shameful gain, but eagerly; not domineering over those in your charge, but being examples to the flock.

text: What reward is promised to elders who shepherd faithfully when the Chief Shepherd appears?
verseText: And when the chief Shepherd appears, you will receive the unfading crown of glory.

text: How should younger men relate to the elders?
verseText: Likewise, you who are younger, be subject to the elders.

text: What attitude should all believers clothe themselves with toward one another?
verseText: Clothe yourselves, all of you, with humility toward one another, for “God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble.”

text: What should believers cast upon God, because He cares for them?
verseText: casting all your anxieties on him, because he cares for you.

text: How are believers instructed to respond to the devil?
options: Resist him, firm in the faith
verseText: Resist him, firm in your faith, knowing that the same kinds of suffering are being experienced by your brotherhood throughout the world.

text: After believers have suffered a little while, what will the God of all grace do?
options: Himself restore, confirm, strengthen, and establish them
verseText: And after you have suffered a little while, the God of all grace, who has called you to his eternal glory in Christ, will himself restore, confirm, strengthen, and establish you.
